official_title: A bill to amend section 924(c) of title 18, United States Code, to strengthen existing mandatory penalties for using or carrying a firearm in the commission of a felony, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Omnibus Crime Control Act of 1970 to revise and increase the mandatory penalties for using or carrying a firearm during commission of a Federal felony. Increases the additional penalty imposed for such offense to eight years imprisonment for a first offense (currently, one to ten years), 15 years for a second offense (currently, two to 25 years for a second or subsequent offense), and life imprisonment for a third or subsequent offense. Extends to first offenders the stipulations, currently applicable only to second or subsequent offenders, that the court not suspend any sentence, grant probation, or impose concurrent sentences. Prohibits parole for any offender who is sentenced to imprisonment pursuant to this Act.
